page.title: 14The Old Dairy
page.content: The{Old Dairy}is located opposite the poplar trees to the north of Kinoulton.It was built in{1925}by the Corporation of Kinoulton farmers.They built it to make{Stilton Cheese}and the milk which was delivered by lorry was also supplied by the farmers.It was powered by electricity and some of the water for washing was,pumped under ground by pipes,from the stream running behind the dairy.In the{Second {World War}the dairy was transformed in to a bungalow so some officers from R.A.F.Newton could live there.They named it{Bridge Bungalow because of the bridge over the stream.After the war the officers left and Bridge Bungalow was put up for sale.A few years later the Parsons bought it and renamed{it'The Old {Dairy'}because they wanted to call it by its real name.
